sources.title: West of Nevada (1936) REX BELLüçï COWBOY WESTERN
sources.description:
Starring: Rex Bell, Joan Barclay, Al St. John
Director: Robert F. Hill

Jim Lloyd (Rex Bell) and his quick-witted sidekick Walla Walla Wiggins (Al St. John) come to the aid of Milt Haldain and Bald Eagle, a Navajo Indian, after they are ambushed by ruthless bandits. The two men are transporting a wagon load of stuffed animals, but Jim soon realizes the cargo is far heavier than it should be. Suspecting a hidden fortune in gold, Jim and Walla Walla set out to uncover the truth‚Äîonly to find themselves caught in a dangerous game of deception and greed. 

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: When a gang tries to rob Haldain, Jim and Walla Walla break it up. Haldain is carrying stuffed animals and Jim's suspicion that they are stuffed with gold is soon confirmed. The gang's boss is banker Cutting and he is after Haldain's gold. He also receives Jim's mail at his bank and changes one of Jim's letters to make it look like Jim is after the gold. His sends Haldain's daughter after her father thereby leading the gang to the secret gold field.
metadata.Actors: Rex Bell, Joan Barclay, Al St. John
